item.name: Price List
item.description:
Price list is a collection of items and their assigned prices. An item can exist in multiple price lists. This gives you the ability to assign different prices to the same item. Price lists let you set currency and duration of the prices. For example, if the price list expires, prices of items within the price list will also expire. You can configure the pricing API to include your default price.
When requesting pricelist of items or evaluating promotions, you should mention the price list ID that you want to use.

description.content: Enables you to create a price list. Depending upon the currency code you set for a price list, you will be able to create or update price (using POST/api-offers/price) under the pricelist for the defined currency code only.

item.name: Pricing
item.description: Pricing endpoints let you create and manage price details for one or many items. You can configure the pricing API to include your default price list in all requests.

description.content: Creates or updates price details for one or many items based on given item IDs. Support for currency code is determined based on the currency code you have set while creating the price list, whuch is identified by priceListId in the request body.

Retrieves paginated list of price details based on priceListId and priceId or itemSku or itemId.
The `priceId` path parameter will be treated as itemSku, itemId or _id based on the value of this field. The default search will be done by `itemSku`.
The maximum number of records per page. If the `isActive` flag is sent, the `limit` will be ignored.
Number of pages you wish to retrieve when selecting records in the price offers array. Default is `1`. If the `isActive` flag is true, `page` will be ignored.

If isActive is `false`, offers array response based on limit and page parameters.
If isActive is `true`, only the offer object whose price is active will be returned in the offers array.
Default value is `false`.

(Required) Value for this field can be database ID (_id) of the price or itemSku or itemId based on the type mentioned in the `type` query parameter.
If a type is not specified in the `type` query parameter, you must provide itemSku in this priceId field.
(Required) ID of the priceList to search the price for.

item.name: Price Guard
item.description: Price Guard allows you to create and manage more diversified price-kinds for the item, such as manufacturer recommended retail price (MSRP), minimum advertised price (MAP), floor price, ceiling price, clearance price,  and so on.  Price guard works as a protection mechanism against any further creation of prices for the item. These endpoints let you create and manage such price-kinds.

description.content: Creates a price guard record that can contain various price kinds other than the elemental prices such as base price, sale price, and clearance price.

item.name: Price Kind
item.description: Unlike price guard, price kind endpoint lets you get the fundamental price kinds (for example, base price and sale price) that are created while setting up the item information.

description.content: Retrieves a paginated list of all normal price kinds that are setup earlier. It returns only price-kinds, not the price information. Price kinds indicate if the offer is under clearance or promotion or base price status. If clearance or promotion price is not set up earlier, a price kind is considered as base price.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Promotion
item.description: Promotion is a discount on an item, cart or shipping method based on set conditions. As promotions can be linked to specific price lists, it is important to submit the correct price list ID. Promotion endpoints let you create and manage discounts that will be applied to all customers' carts that meet the required conditions.

item.name: Dynamic Pricing Engine
item.description:
fabric's Dynamic Pricing Engine APIs evaluate promotions and calculate prices instantly for the cart items using real-time price calculation method, that incorporates the latest information, to provide personalized and competitive prices for specific customers. It supports formula based custom SKU dynamic pricing, and shows discount breakdown details for separate items having separate promotions.

It uses the cache information, instead of fetching offer details of items from database, to evaluate promotions and calculate prices instantly. It is fast, scalable to millions of pricing requests per day, and supports complex promotional strategies.

description.content: Evaluates a cart's promotions, discount coupons and implicit promotions, either by specified itemId or by SKU (based on the customer specific configuration set in the backend)

item.name: Segment
item.description: Segment endpoints let you target promotions at specific groups of customers by linking the promotion to a segment identifier. A customer segment is a group of customers that have been given a unique reference to easily identify them. They may be grouped in a number of ways such as demographics, locations, device type, and so on. fabric Offers supports the assignment of a customer segment to a promotion so that the promotion is applied only to a specific group of customers. You must enter your customer segment identifiers in the *Settings* of the Copilot application.

item.name: Upload price CSV
item.description: This endpoint lets you bulk upload price details using a CSV file.

item.name: Generate URL to bulk upload price details

request.name: Generate URL to bulk upload price details

description.content:
This endpoint lets you generate a secured S3 URL using which you can upload the CSV file containing price details. Ensure that all the headers and values in the CSV file are double-quoted. After a file is uploaded, it is processed internally to apply bulk changes to price details.

**Note:** The maximum number of rows with price records to upload per CSV file is 5000.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Attributes
item.description: Attributes refer to a collection of attributes names and their values. Using attributes, you can group entities, such as products or shoppers, that share similar characteristics, such as dimension, age group, location, device type, and more. For example, the shopper segmentation can be used to tailor promotions to a specific customer segment by linking the promotion to the segment identifier.

description.content: Using this endpoint, you can get a paginated list of attributes. By specfiying the pagination criteria, such as `offset` and `limit`, you can tailor the search results.
The maximum number of records per page.
The number of records to skip before returning records. For example, when offset is 20 and limit is 10, this endpoint returns records from 21 to 30.
The maximum number of records per page.
The number of records to skip before returning records. For example, when offset is 20 and limit is 10, this endpoint returns records from 21 to 30.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Verify whether the specified attributes are linked to any offers

request.name: Verify whether the specified attributes are linked to any offers

description.content: Use this endpoint to verify whether the specified attribute IDs are active and being used in any promotion or coupon. The objective is to prevent deletion of attributes that are already linked to active or scheduled promotions and coupons.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

fabric's Offers APIs let you set up and manage stock keeping unit (SKU) prices. Its wide range of coupon and promotion features let you design discounts ranging from single-use, customer-specific coupons to site-wide promotions applicable for all SKUs.

Contact Support:
 Email: support@fabric.inc
